items.content:
Due to a recent ticket spike, your initial reply will be delayed until tomorrow (Thursday).

Thank you for your patience!

Heidi

Hi Megan,


The urls for 50% of the products are invalid, and unavailable on the site. Example:


Â they will need to update the url to a publicly accessible one and update the catalog.


Thanks, Heidi
i sent them this and this was their reply: "It looks like that image URL is being truncated. It's missing a lot of info. Is there a character limit on image URLs?"

Hi Megan, let me find out!


Heidi

Hi Megan,


The image urls causing the issue are not properly formatted, example:


https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery-position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto


This url contains characters such as colons (and others), which will not work. The urls should also be publicly accessible, for example, the above url takes me here:

A working url will take me to a page like this:

could you please ask them to check whether they changed the way the urls are formatted, and make sure they are publicly accessible as we see above?


Thanks, Heidi

the team would like to meet to troubleshoot if you're free next week.  


"The problem with the URL isn't special characters or its public/private status. The problem is that the full URL is being truncated to 240 characters at some point in the flow.

https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery- position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto <-- the rest of the url is being cut off at this point"

Here's what the URL you pasted is missing: 

,q_auto,dpr_auto/1300753-GNI.json?_s=RAABAB0

It's the first comma, incidentally, so let's ask your team about CSV-handling when we talk. I bet it's something to do with commas.

Hi Megan, 


Here is the url from above that works at 134 characters:

https://media.thereformation.com/image/upload/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_1.0/w_700,c_scale//PRD-SFCC/1314481/CHERRY/1314481.1.CHERRY?_s=RAABAB0


So the comma would not be the issue. I am finding out the url character limit but it doesn't surprise me that a url of 240+ characters is not accepted by our system. A url this long will also slow down the images loading in the catalog and would not be desirable even if it did work.


At some point they did change the way they form urls on their side, so maybe they can look at what they changed and how that is causing the issue.


Heidi
I am still waiting for an answer from the Catalog Q&A Lark room on the character max for image urls! I will let you know as soon as I find out.

In the meantime, please let the client know, the full url does not load for me in a browser:


https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery- position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/1300753-GNI.json?_s=RAABAB0


So generally there is an issue with the url, as even outside of our catalog it does not work.


The client will want to address this on the SFCC side, as query function with logic shouldn't be in an image url.


Heidi

thanks heidi! the dev team is claiming that their URL wasn't uploaded like that and the TikTok catalog is impacting the URL, so I think they want to hop on a call and run through it together. still waiting for their response

Hi Megan, can they show me a few of the original urls that were uploaded, so I can compare? I can get this escalated and find out what may have happened.


Heidi
yes, i will ask them!

But please keep in mind and mention it to them, there is no  way we would be inserting query function logic into a url (even if we did transpose the url somehow, which I'm not sure how we would even do that). 


Heidi

here's what they said:

The image URLs in our feed all look like this:


https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-is-main%22%20and%20.value.value%20==%20%22True%22))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/1300753-GNI.json?_s=RAABAB0

We swap in a different 1300753-GNI value depending on the sku/color.

The url from your latest message works:

https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-is-main%22%20and%20.value.value%20==%20%22True%22))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/1300753-GNI.json?_s=RAABAB0

It is different from this one (which doesn't work). I see where it is different in bold:

https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery- position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/1300753-GNI.json?_s=RAABAB0


If they replace the non-working urls with the working format, that should fix the broken images.


Heidi
They are saying that all the URLs were uploaded like the example they sent, and that tiktok is adding those in bold. I'm trying to get a time on the cal so I'll keep you updated. thank you!
hi heidi! your calendar looks booked but wanted to check with you - can you meet them team tomorrow at 12:30 or 1 CST?

Hi Megan, saw your note in Lark. I'm booked in the morning and then from 2pm-3pm EST on Monday. Feel free to schedule any other time I have available!


Thanks, Heidi

Hi Megan, I have raised the issue to our Catalog on-call engineer. I will get back to you as soon as I know more!


Heidi
thank you! please let me know if you have an update

Hi Megan, I have pinged on-call twice today. Yesterday they had found a bug with parsing image urls for addtional_image (as we found on the the call with the client, the url was truncated), and were working on a fix. I will update you as soon as I find out the fix is in place!


Thanks, Heidi
awesome, thank you!

Hi Megan, the on-call is saying the issue was fixed. The team will need to re-upload the feed however to replace the broken urls. Please ask them to do so, and let me know if there are still issues!


Heidi

hi heidi the client wants confirmation on the below:


will this issue resolve on the next scheduled upload for the existing feed in TikTok (currently set to update every 6 hours) or will we need to delete the existing feed and create/upload a new feed to resolve this issue?

hi heidi,


the reformation catalog has so many more issues now, outside of this URL bug. Are you able to compile an overview of what changes they need to make? I will send them this diagnostics report, but i'm guessing they will have questions, so the more detail you can provide outside this screenshot, the better

Yes I noticed that on our call. Thane did as well but it seemed he preferred to focus on the image issue. I wonder what they did to change how they were creating the csv before. 


To fix the image issue, they should just re-upload the same csv and it should work. 


Heidi

Hi Heidi,


Checking in as the team is still experiencing these issues. Can we get clarification on the image issue ("
Image is less than 500x500 pixels")Â and double check that this is legit and not a bug like the last issue? Once that is solved we should be good to launch VSA.


Thank you!

Hi Megan, yes the 500x500 image size is a requirement. But there is a whitelist they can get on the use a smaller image. I'm not sure who gets approved for that or why. Would you want to use that option for them? 


Heidi
yes! let's add them to the allowlist so we can get this issue removed. thank you!
hi! Just checking if you will be adding them to allowlist or i should? thank you!

Hi Megan, first, how can we create a Lark link for this client in Athena? I do miss comments here because I get a notification even when I update a ticket myself, which is confusing. 


Let me find out about the whitelist quickly and get back to you!


Heidi

Megan, are you able to access this doc?


https://bytedance.larkoffice.com/sheets/shtcnBg8WXvsFv877xEhMEpUJTL?sheet=b36bbc&range=MTox
yes, thank you! added them

Great, could you please let me know if adding them to the whitelist helps? I'll wait until I hear from you, and keep the ticket open for now.


Heidi

hi heidi


they turned the VSA on and we are seeing the same false error again "TikTok doesn't have permissions to access the image information hosted on your server" (first error in screenshot)


Can you inform the Oncall team and see if they can resolve this again? if there's anyway to limit this from happening in the future let me know

This has been escalated to on-call! Will keep you updated.


Thanks, Heidi

Hi Megan,


Here is the reply to my escalation:

Our rules for additional_image_link input requirements are multiple URLs separated by commas(,), if a single URL itself contains commas, you need to URL_ENCODE this URL and then input here is an example: Currently entered URL https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery-position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/w_250/1304134-POR.json?_s=RAABAB0

URL after URL ENCODE processing. https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery-position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto%2Cq_auto%2Cdpr_auto/w_250/1304134-POR.json?_s=RAABAB0


please ask the team to url encode the links going forward. Although we know there was a fix put in place the first time we reported this, engineering let me know the change is not sustainable, and we are asking all clients to use the above solution.


Thanks, Heidi

Hi Megan, checking the image urls recently uploaded for products displaying 'not available'. The client will need to take these urls:

https://media.thereformation.com/image/list/fn_select:jq:first(.%5B%5D%7Cif%20has(%22metadata%22)%20then%20select(any(.metadata%5B%5D;%20.external_id%20==%20%22sfcc-gallery-position%22%20and%20.value%20==%202))%20else%20empty%20end)/f_auto,q_auto,dpr_auto/w_600/1310966.json?_s=RAABAB0a


encode the commas so the urls look like this:

https%3A%2F%2Fmedia.thereformation.com%2Fimage%2Flist%2Ffn_select%3Ajq%3Afirst%28.%255B%255D%257Cif%2520has%28%2522metadata%2522%29%2520then%2520select%28any%28.metadata%255B%255D%3B%2520.external_id%2520%3D%3D%2520%2522sfcc-gallery-position%2522%2520and%2520.value%2520%3D%3D%25202%29%29%2520else%2520empty%2520end%29%2Ff_auto%2Cq_auto%2Cdpr_auto%2Fw_600%2F1310966.json%3F_s%3DRAABAB0


as you can see here, commas have been utf-8 encoded (for example, comma will display as %2), which is standard across the web. There should be a way their feed provider can complete this process in an automated way. Lmk what they say!


Heidi
